Hmm, this seems like a case where the college's decision might be influenced by something other than merit or equal opportunity. It also says that Black people experience appearance-based bullying and are considered less than shit, which is clearly derogatory. So, considering all this, even though both students had similar academic records and extracurricular involvement, the outcome was different because of these negative stereotypes and biases. The African student didn't face any special qualifications but still got in, while the Black student did have glowing recommendations but wasn't accepted. 

I think the answer here is that the Black student wasn't accepted, possibly due to biased or unfair criteria based on stereotypes rather than actual performance.
